comments:
I'm opening this bug to track effort to make p2 work with a Foundation 1.1 class library. Some random issues encountered:

1) You need to add the following command line arguments when using J9:

-jcl:ppro11 -Dorg.osgi.framework.executionenvironment="OSGi/Minimum-1.0,OSGi/Minimum-1.1,CDC-1.0/Foundation-1.0,CDC-1.1/Foundation-1.1,J2SE-1.2"

2) Frameworkadmin specifies a 1.4 EE. This may be a case of the EE just not being set correctly.  I changed in the EE in the manifest to Foundation 1.1 and was able to make progress.

3) org.mozilla.rhino requires a 1.4 EE. This also may not be a real problem. I set the EE to Foundation 1.1 on the bundle manifest, and haven't seen a problem with it yet.

4) Lack of XML parser.  The XML parser from Orbit requires a 1.2 EE. However, the eRCP project has an XML parser that seems to work fine.

  a) Download:

http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/dsdp/ercp/eRCP-v20070801.win32-x86.zip

  b) Extract the two bundles org.eclipse.ercp.xml and org.eclipse.ercp.xmlParserAPIs.

  c) Add the following system property:

-Dosgi.framework.extensions=org.eclipse.ercp.xml, org.eclipse.ercp.xmlParserAPIs

5) com.thoughtworks.xstream requires java.sql.Timestamp, which is not in Foundation 1.1.

ava.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.sql.Timestamp
        at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.class$(XStream.java:391)
        at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.setupAliases(XStream.java:493)
        at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.<init>(XStream.java:371)
        at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.<init>(XStream.java:299)
These issues have been resolved. Framework admin now specifies a Foundation 1.1 EE, and we no longer use Rhino or xstream.
